callforshadab wrote:
> Hi all,
>
> (i am not sure, but I think that) the current HTMLExtractor or other
> extractors extract only links from web pages probably using regular
> expressions.

Thats right.
>
> i want to extract all information associated with each link.
> For eg: their is a link
> <a href="......">My Web</a>
> and i want href value and the text "My Web". from this link.
>
> Similarly if the link is like
> <a href="...> <img src="....gif" alt="">Mail</a>
> from this link i want to extract href value, img src value its alt
> text and the anchor text "Mail".
>
> How can i use the existing extractors for getting these informations ?

Current extractors don't do this.  They just find links.

You'll need to amend them or do your own processor; perhaps one that 
first creates a DOM of the webpage.  A DOM would make it easier 
extracting just the particulars you are interested in.

St.Ack
